entry.title: Combined summary - Regtest Address Version Change Proposal
entry.summary: The context discusses a proposal put forward by Warren Togami Jr. to change the address versions in -regtest mode in Bitcore, so they are unique and no longer identical to testnet. The proposed change would involve altering the prefix for regtest pubkey hash addresses so that they begin with either 'r' or 'R'. The purpose of this change is to ensure uniqueness. However, it is important to determine if any existing tools would need to be modified to support this change to regtest. It is unclear if existing tools outside of pull tester expect regtest to have testnet addresses. If only a small quantity of tools currently handle regtest, then modifying them to the new address versions may be feasible. The team needs to assess whether any existing tools would need to be modified to accommodate this change. Bitcoinj supports and uses regtest mode but would also have to be changed. Mike Hearn raises questions regarding the rationale for the change and what the cost of having the addresses be the same would be. There is a concern that changing the address code would disrupt a bunch of people and seems kind of annoying. The discussion highlights that the network is guessed from the address version in several places in the code, making it difficult to modify the address versions without disrupting a lot of people. The email ends with an advertisement for SauceLabs and a link to the Bitcoin-development mailing list. Overall, the main focus of the discussion is on whether it is feasible to change the address versions in -regtest mode to ensure uniqueness while minimizing disruption to existing tools.
